title: 111_s1737
content: The "Expand School Meals Act of 2009" is also known as the Short Title. It includes a phased-in increase in income eligibility guidelines for free school lunches and breakfasts. Section 9(b) of the Richard B. Russell National School Lunch Act is amended to establish income eligibility guidelines for free lunches based on family size income levels. The budget is adjusted annually for school years starting in 2010, 2011, and 2012. Income eligibility guidelines for free lunches are established based on family size income levels. The budget is adjusted annually for school years starting in 2010, 2011, and 2012. Income eligibility guidelines for free lunches are established based on family size income levels. In subparagraph (E), the amount of revisions is specified. SEC. 102. PERIOD OF EFFECTIVENESS. The amendments made by section 101 shall be effective from the date of enactment of this Act until June 30, 2013. TITLE II--PERMANENT CHANGE SEC. 201. FREE LUNCH ELIGIBILITY. Section 9(b)(1) of the Richard B. Russell National School Lunch Act is amended to establish income eligibility guidelines for free lunches at 185 percent. Section 9 of the Richard B. Russell National School Lunch Act is amended to adjust the frequency and amount of revisions, as well as income eligibility guidelines for free lunches at 185 percent. The Richard B. Russell National School Lunch Act is amended to change the wording to "free" instead of "free or reduced price" in various paragraphs. The Richard B. Russell National School Lunch Act is amended to change wording related to clauses and percentages in paragraph (7). In paragraph (7), amendments are made to change wording related to meals policy. In paragraph (9), changes are made by striking certain clauses. Amendments are made to the Richard B. Russell National School Lunch Act, including redesignating subparagraphs, striking references to reduced price lunches, and removing mentions of reduced cost or price in various subsections. Amendments to the Lunch Act include striking references to reduced price lunches and removing certain language in subsections. Amendments to the Lunch Act involve removing references to reduced price lunches in various clauses and subparagraphs. Amendments to the Lunch Act involve removing references to reduced price lunches in various clauses and subparagraphs, including striking mentions of reduced price in paragraphs (2) and (3)(B)(iii)(I), subsections (b) and (d), and in subsection (e). Amendments to the Richard B. Russell National School Lunch Act involve removing references to reduced price lunches in various clauses and subparagraphs. This includes striking mentions of reduced price in multiple sections and redesignating certain subparagraphs. Amendments to the Richard B. Russell National School Lunch Act involve removing references to reduced price lunches in various clauses and subparagraphs, including striking mentions of reduced price in multiple sections and redesignating certain subparagraphs. The Expand School Meals Act of 2009 amends the Richard B. Russell National School Lunch Act by updating eligibility determinations for free and reduced-price meals based on income guidelines. The Expand School Meals Act of 2009 updates eligibility determinations for free and reduced-price meals based on income guidelines under the Richard B. Russell National School Lunch Act. The Expand School Meals Act of 2009 updates eligibility determinations for free and reduced-price meals under the Richard B. Russell National School Lunch Act by removing references to "reduced price" in various sections. The Secretary of Agriculture will implement changes to eligibility determinations for free and reduced-price school meals as per transition rules established. SEC. 202. FREE BREAKFAST ELIGIBILITY. Section 4 of the Child Nutrition Act of 1966 is amended to remove references to reduced price breakfasts and streamline certain subparagraphs. Section 4 of the Child Nutrition Act of 1966 is amended to remove references to reduced price meals and streamline certain subparagraphs. The Child Nutrition Act of 1966 is amended to remove references to reduced price meals in various subsections and paragraphs. The amendments made by this title will be effective starting on July 1, 2013.
